5.27.20  8:27 am   How would you describe your best moment but in burrito 

      it's the precise moment that the burrito becomes a burrito. not later, not before. any moment earlier, burrito was not a burrito, any moment later, burrito already has been a burrito before. looking for that precise moment the burrito achieves burritohood

5.27.20  8:27 am   What languages do u speak 

      flowers

5.27.20  8:27 am   what is your favorite flower

      something i've discovered, about flowers, it only works if you treat different flowers as your favorite, at different times. otherwise you'd probably only just use 1 flower all the time. which can be a great form of expression but not so great for communicating complex ideas and concepts

5.27.20  8:06 am   do you have a favourite word?

     no

      as in, a word that you like the most. of all the words there are. i know that's a lot of words so don't feel too much pressure

     something i've discovered, about words, it only works if you treat different words as your favorite, at different times. otherwise you'd probably only just say 1 word all the time. which can be a great form of expression but not so great for communicating complex ideas and concepts

5.27.20  7:19 am   what's your song writing process?

      i just have to come up with something, and then i have to figure out if it's the beginning or not. and if it's the beginning, then i have to figure out what comes next, and if it's not the beginning then i need to figure out what comes first, and then what comes next

5.27.20  7:15 am   Hi! Thanks for existing. I love your music and question-answering abilities! How do you make decisions without being overwhelmed by the sheer number of possibilities?

      you're going to want to make your own decision-making TV show, where your television audience can follow along on your wild ride of the decisions you must make. Now suddenly your overwhelm has turned into an adventure for the whole family

5.27.20  6:50 am   Do the days go on?

      trying to find some counter argument here, but no, you are exactly right, that is what they do

      i have never thought about pomegranates

      regular

      of what

5.27.20  1:48 am   what is your opinion on the Double Ristretto Venti Half-Soy Nonfat Decaf Organic Chocolate Brownie Iced Vanilla Double-Shot Gingerbread Frappuccino Extra Hot With Foam Whipped Cream Upside Down Double Blended, One Sweet'N Low and One Nutrasweet, and Ice

      might be a bit watered down, because it was made extra hot and then had ice put in it

5.27.20  1:29 am   Is snow just a texture pack for the Earth

      after it's on the ground, yes. but while it's falling, it is a much more advanced and dynamic simulation. and then when it's melting, it's a whole other set of simulations. houdini type stuff i imagine

5.27.20  1:23 am   How did you go about writing "might quit"?

      the original idea was just the verse melody, which occured in a dream. so i noted it down accordingly, and added it to the song list. then, some time in the future, it was selected in the selection process, to be the next song to be written/recorded. so i went about the writing process as normal. first, determine if what you have is the beginning, which i determined yes it is, then you need to find what the lyrics are for that part, which is not necessarily the way i prefer to work because usually i need lyrics and melody to be born at the exact same time, but this would be an exception because the melody already came to me for free in a dream. so i figured out the lyrics to that stanza, and then just move forward from there on a moment to moment basis, trying to make the strongest song i can

5.27.20  1:08 am   the things you say on here and in your videos - do you tend to mean them genuinely, or are they ironic? or is it a mix of both?

     trying to find just the right blend, to provide maximum enrichment and nourishment for the customer

      anyway, no worries if you don't want to answer this. if not, here's a different question: if you had the option to be a bumblebee right now, would you take it?

     no

      (you would still be able to make songs, but they would be for bees :)

5.27.20  1:08 am   Im planning on existing, what do you think would be the first step?

      tell all your friends and neighbors

      the trouble is, that can only be described with music. so i would love to convey it but i must use music. that's probably the reason i do music

      very logical. no continuity errors

5.26.20  10:57 pm   Thank you! That was helpful advice about mixing. So, if I can ask again, is it your preference to do all the settings for compression manually, or to tweak a preset compression? I don't know what type of program you use but are those presets helpful? Anyway, I'm excited to keep learning and improving! 

      here's what i would do. set the 'make up gain' to zero, just to eliminate confusion. In the early days, i would add compression on the default setting, and it had like 4db of makeup gain on it. so i was assuming it was doing something. but it wasn't enough, because some parts were still too loud/soft. so i still had to do extensive manual adjustments to the volume (not compression, just drawing a line to adjust the volume over time. very tedious, but worth it.) Then one day i finally realized that the compression actually wasn't doing anything, it had just given a 4db boost which tricked me into thinking it was doing something. so maybe get rid of the makeup gain, just so you know what you're dealing with. if your compressor has a visual representation (like a slanted line, etc), that's great. Basically the whole trick is, look at the 'gain reduction' meter. That should be a little light or something that will tell you when it's actually cutting the volume. and it should tell you at each moment how much it is actually reducing the sound. Set your ratio (that's how steep the slant is) set that to maybe..... 2:1? 3:1? it depends on what you're using it for, what instrument, or whatever. that is how slanted it is. Basically 1:1 means it's doing nothing. if you look at the visual representation it should be a perfect 45deg diagonal line. that means it's doing nothing. 2:1 or 3:1 will be less steep. But you should also see a bend in the line..... it will be exactly 45degrees below a certain point, and then it should bend, to be what your ratio is (so probably less steep). Now if you adjust the threshold, it should move that bend point up and down. if you move the bend point down, it means it's squashing more of the sound... like even the quieter parts. If you move the threshold up, it should be doing Less, and only squashing the loudest parts. as you move the threshold up and down, you should notice the gain reduction meter doing more, or less. As you move the threshold down, you should see the gain reduction meter coming on a lot more often, and you'll probably hear what it's doing. you'll hear the sound being squashed-all the loud parts will be squashed down to the same volume as the medium parts (somewhat, depending on the steepness of your ratio). so just adjust the threshold up and down until you get what you want. The trick is, if the gain reduction meter is doing nothing, then you can be sure nothing is happening. so definitely change it until you see some action there, otherwise it's doing nothing. then of course, once you get that right, you'll have to bring up the makeup gain. because it will have made the overall volume mostly lower. that's why presets will probably not work right, because it doesn't know how loud your material is. so you have to play around until you 'find' where the volume levels are on your track, and so it can be acting appropriately to curb the peaks just the right amount. hope that helps

5.26.20  10:51 pm   why is my dog a rat

      oh man, you've got yourself a dograt. i've heard about those

5.26.20  10:49 pm   How on earth are you able to keep up with these questions?

      i have a question answering button. i actually have 2 so i can use both hands

5.26.20  10:41 pm   why do you put the time the question was asked but not the time it was answered

      because 2 dates on each question would make everyone go to sleep due to confusion

5.26.20  10:39 pm   how do you get motivation to do the things you want to/should do

      if it's something you want to do, then that means you are already motivated to do it. if it's something you should do, then you need to understand a little better why you should. or if you even agree that you should. and if you don't agree that you should, then it really comes down to the consequences/rewards of doing it, etc, whatever agreement is in place between you and whomever thinks you should

5.26.20  10:13 pm   When do you plan on making music videos again I love them. 

      extremely right away immediately

      oh hell yeah
